section.name: Start a project
section.span: Setting up a new project with Hippo Site Toolkit 2 using a Maven archetype
section.p: The Hippo Site Toolkit 2 is a toolkit for developing JSP based websites using the Hippo ECM stack. This page helps you to get up and running with your own HST-2 based project as quickly as possible. It is assumed that you have Maven 2 installed, and that you have some basic knowledge on how to use it.

subsection.name: Creating your project
subsection.p: To kick start your project, you can use the hippo-ecm-hst-archetype-start template. The default code provides: a custom ECM project containing a pre-configured content repository and CMS, sample content, and a sample website.

Maven will create a project for you (in a newly created directory named myproject) containing 3 subprojects:

li.p: ecm - a pre-configured content repository and CMS
content - sample content including a document type and some documents for the sample site
site - a sample JSP based website

subsection.name: Deploying your project in Tomcat
subsection.p: Download Tomcat 6.0 from the Apache Tomcat website and install it. In the following instructions we assume you installed it in a directory named apache-tomcat-6.0.16.
Start Tomcat with one of the startup scripts in apache-tomcat-6.0.16/bin.
Hippo CMS is now available at http://localhost:8080/cms/. You can login as user admin using the password admin. The sample website is now available at http://localhost:8080/site/preview/index.
